## targetGLSL variable

GLSL code gen, targets GLSL ES 3.00 (WebGL2) by default.

Use options object to configure shader type and GLSL version: `100` for WebGL, 300 for WebGL2. Currently, the only differences in terms of code generation, not correctness, are:

- attribute, varying, uniform declarations - texture lookup function naming

Unsupported features in GLSL 100:

- Fragment shader output vars

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
targetGLSL: (opts?: Partial<GLSLOpts> | undefined) => GLSLTarget
```
